job_title: Applications Support Analyst in Claremont, CA
pros: I love working for Scripps College. Work is not stressful, hours are great. Lot of time off during the holidays and love the people.
cons: Pay could be higher and growth could be faster.

pros: Two meal swipes at the dining hall a week. Nice environment.
cons: Could use more money and hours.

pros: Growth opportunities, management skill building, problem solving
cons: Lack of organization, high turnover rate with colleagues.

pros: Great work life balance Friendly people Generous benefits Generous perks (twice weekly free lunch plus lots of free food/swag at events, gifts, children's college tuition assistance, etc.) Ample vacation Transparency from leadership Promotes from within Offer's professional development
cons: Pay slightly below competitive standard

pros: Friendly and collegial environment with an opportunity to engage in a variety of committees and organizations.
cons: Mis-alignment in strategic efforts and impactful results.

review_title: Beautiful campus and kind people to work with, but overall lack of shared vision for the community.
job_title: Live Events Technician in Claremont, CA
pros: I've worked with some incredible and creative people. The events here are inspiring, and the campus is gorgeous.
cons: It sometimes feels as though I am not being invested in and there is little room for me to grow here unless I change departments entirely. There doesn't seem to be a shared vision for this community, nor does it feel like there is a clear understanding of where I'm headed in my career.

pros: This is a terrific place to teach. The campus is exquisite, parking is easy, and the students are really wonderful. They even provide free lunch for faculty and staff.
cons: It's the same as at every other college in Los Angeles (for PT adjuncts) -- employment stability and benefits.

pros: lot of flexibility, great managers
cons: not a lot of career development

pros: I love being a student worker at Scripps. The staff is very understanding that I sometimes need to call off or be a little late as I am a student first. They really ensure I feel cared for as well. I work in the Career planning & resources department and I feel a sense of family. Even after I ran out of work-study funds I was able to keep working and get paid!
cons: I love it! No cons for me

pros: You end up meeting a lot of people as everyone's mail goes through you. Very social position. Lots of movement- I would hit over 6,000 steps over 5 hour session.
cons: It can get really busy at times. Sometimes packages get lost/delayed and students get upset.

pros: Great location, nice campus, good community, and wonderful weather.
cons: high living expenses, housing is very expensive.

review_title: Poor leadership and great opportunity to learn
pros: Learn as much as you can, focus on the positive and use your experience to move on and forward.
cons: Poor and absent leadership, words and actions do not agree.

pros: work-life balance, benefits, good culture
cons: Low pay compared to similar institutions

job_title: Medical Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: very easy to get hired.
cons: NA na na na na

pros: Phonathon had great training, great teammates, and it was great to connect with alumnae from the college.
cons: While I was there, there were lots of management changes - some were easier to work with than others.

pros: Good hours, flexible, great place as a student
cons: I don't have any cons

review_title: i would recommend to a friend
pros: good benefits. good campus culture.
cons: depending on the department youre in, vibes can be bad

pros: Lots of responsibility and a great first job to a college student.
cons: There is a lot of workload for students during the week. If you're a manager.

job_title: Shift Leader in Los Angeles, CA
pros: advancing mission of college, work with friends
cons: admin too focused on aesthetics of school rather than students

pros: stable employment, fun to work with peers
cons: high turnover, lack of investment in student workers, lack of incentives

review_title: Exciting and productive work environment for undergraduate students!
job_title: Undergraduate Student in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Thoughtful and effective leadership, provided me with experience in marketing, research and non-profit work, including the center's grant program.
cons: Job only available to current Scripps students.

pros: Flexible hours, set your own schedule, low commitment
cons: Not really any cons to this job

pros: Great atmosphere, community owned and managed
cons: None at all for this

review_title: Fantastic experience as long as status quo is maintained...
pros: I loved most of the people I worked with, very cordial yet mostly respectful atmosphere. Benefits such as health care, dental, vision, retirement plans were superb. There was some opportunity for professional development as well as tuition reimbursement, great educational plan for dependents.
cons: Office politics are a serious issue and sometimes interferes with professional dealings. Hiring is usually based on graduating from Scripps or one of the Claremont Colleges and will almost guarantee you a position (even with no experience). Favoritism is also an issue, maintaining the status quo is upheld here when there are certain things that really do need to change for a better educational institution. The ability for promotions is limited.

review_title: Very relaxed job, nice employers, and you're working with peers
job_title: Customer Service Associate in Claremont, CA
pros: You can just sit and use your computer for most of the time, although obviously you need to make sure your other duties are done first. But yeah, it's great as a college student because it's an on campus job and they recognize the importance of your studies. Super understanding employers if you need to take time off etc. You're also working mainly with your peers, so it's good for building relationships at the schools.
cons: Communication isn't always great; there's been a number of times that a customer asked a question about something and I realized I'd never been informed about that event/equipment/random other thing. There's some training initiatives that seem unnecessary or too long, and overall not the most effective method.

pros: the work life balance is really good, the company allows for a lot of flexibility and is good at supporting staff if staff encounters personal problems.
cons: faculty can be difficult to work with. there is a very political campus culture that affects the work culture.

job_title: Building Manager, Tiernan Field House in Claremont, CA
pros: Very centrally located and managers respect course loads when scheduling. Gained experience that I can take with me to future jobs.
cons: The management is shaky and not always reliable. They pretend to listen to the concerns of students without taking tangible action to improve or change the space.

pros: The campus offices are very flexible and understanding of student schedules. While the pay is not great, it is usually above minimum wage, and applying for/getting a job is generally not difficult.
cons: It can be hard to find a job if you are not work-study, but there are opportunities available if you look hard enough.

pros: Very nice people. People are usually able and willing to help out when you have a question or need advice about work
cons: Sometimes people aren'y as motivated as I would have liked. Scripps could definitely evolve more in technical aspects

job_title: Associate Researcher in Rancho Cucamonga, CA
pros: There were a number of great staff members, I enjoyed working with them and learning from them.
cons: There were a few staff members who were not team players, and made it difficult for those who were.

pros: Fun opportunity to work with younger students and professors. Great for reviewing MCAT material.
cons: This isnt a job where you can do your homework and get paid for it.

pros: Loved the students, staff, parents, and alumni.  Amazing community!
cons: I'm not sure there were any.  I really enjoyed my time there and had a supportive boss.

review_title: Not a very positive work culture
pros: It's a beautiful campus, and the students are kind and motivated.
cons: Lots of political battles amongst the faculty and a lot of false promises.

review_title: $20/hr to work as a fitness instructor at the school gym
pros: Flexible hours. Kind, communicative boss.
cons: Little diversity. White dominant students/staff/environment. Not a full-time job opportunity.

review_title: Review of Co-Coordinator of Scripps Advocates for Survivors of Sexual Assault
job_title: Co-Coordinator of Scripps Advocates for Survivors of Sexual Assault in Claremont, CA
pros: - supportive, open, committed, and empowering community
cons: - students were not highly engaged at events

job_title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager in Claremont, CA
pros: Many opportunities to make friends and have valuable experience for your resume!
cons: I have no complaints. It was a nice environment.

job_title: Student Lab Assistant in Claremont, CA
pros: Lovely students, though some lab techs were not helpful towards their students learning.
cons: Low pay for private institution.

pros: you can create your own schedule
cons: depending on your student job, it can be boring

pros: Passionate, dedicated, and passionate staff
cons: Sometimes hard to get food in the dining hall

pros: It was super fun and I learned a lot!
cons: None at all, I loved it!

pros: Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent tutors
cons: minimum wage and littler opportunities for private tutoring

review_title: Wouldn't do it again, but learned a lot.
pros: Staff was great. Very collaborative environment.
cons: Students are very entitled

pros: On-campus, treated well, hours compatible with classes
cons: not that many hours
